reviewText: Underrated 1990s indie comedy. Sure, some of the humor is timely and requires that you remember or have some knowledge of the early 1990s to understand what they are referring to. The final 20 minutes become a bit sentimental. But overall very good film.
Still funny after all these years.
Great comedy flick from the 90's. The actor who plays Splick is hilarious.

This review is an excerpt from my book "Killer B's: The 237 Best Movies On Video You've (Probably) Never Seen," which is available as an ebook on Amazon. If you enjoy this review, there are 236 more like it in the book (plus a whole lot more). Check it out!

MY LIFE'S IN TURNAROUND: Low-budget, independent movies about guys trying to make a low-budget, independent movie were a cottage industry around this time, but this one is much more: It's a buddy flick up, with a romantic comedy back--and a very funny, original film (subtitle: "Based on a true story"). It's really about two American dreamers; lovable losers on a quest for success.

How funny you find this flick will depend entirely on how funny you find Schaeffer and Ward. I love `em: they're a Gen-X Abbott and Costello on speed, with machine gun delivery and a gift for wacky dialog and description. Besides, how can you not like guys who invented the "self high-five," or who do a "we have girlfriends now" dance? They're sweet, nice and funny --and they've made one smart movie about two dumb guys.

I watched this on Flix on long ago it was a friday night, not much on.  I saw the Madonna look a like and the caught my intrest.  WOW this is a good movie.  The two men are like albert and Coastello.  Only more funny.  I am a huge fan of Eric Schaeffer is genus hes the perfect wirter I am going to watch his "If Lucy Fell" I love this movie because it is filmed in New York I love most movies filmed in New York.

Although "Turnaround" unsuprisingly doesn't have much to offer in terms of image/audio quality, the film itself is funny at worth checking out - especially for the low retail price of $9.99 - and less at most stores.
Inane.  Sophomoric.  Phoebe Cates could not make up for the rest of the cast or plot (if there was one).  Don't waste your time or money.

I find Eric Schaeffer is one of the best filmmakers to come on to the scene. My Life's in Turnaround is one of my favorite movies. If you enjoyed the Television series, New York Daze/Too Something then you should  definitly see this movie, along with If Lucy Fell.
